Pages.Name: npc_template_maker
Pages.Description: An entity that creates NPCs. The NPCs it creates are clones of a template NPC. NPCs are spawned around this maker's origin, or at specified destination points.

Properties.Description: The name of this entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Entities with parents move with their parent.
The name of the bone or attachment to attach to on the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Use !bonemerge to use bone-merge style attachment.
Offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Angular offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Scale in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Whether to respect the specified local offset when doing the initial hierarchical attachment to its parent.
Name(s) of script files that are executed after all entities have spawned.
The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
Radius around this maker within which NPCs are to be placed. Spawned NPCs will try and find empty space within this radius to spawn.

If you'd like spawned NPCs to be created at an info_npc_spawn_destination entity, enter the name of that entity here. If you have more than one destination entity by that name, the Destination Criteria will be used to select one from the group.
Should the NPC try to spawn at a destination that the player can see? Only applicable if a Destination Group is being used.
Should the NPC try to spawn nearest to or farthest from the player's current location? Only applicable if a Destination Group is being used.
The spawn destination node distance to the player will have to be further or equal than this value.
Number of NPCs that will spawn before this spawner is exhausted.
How often (in seconds) a new NPC will be spawned. If set to -1, a new NPC will be made when the last NPC dies.
How long (in seconds) to wait before trying again after failing to spawn an NPC when no valid spot could be found. If set to -1, Spawn Frequency is used.
Maximum number of live children allowed at any one time (new ones will not be made until one dies). If set to -1, no limit is applied.
How NPC's hull should be checked at spawn destination?
Template NPC that this maker should be creating clones of.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParent
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachment
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on its parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachmentMaintainOffset
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on it's parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment. The entity will maintain it's position relative to the parent at the time it is attached.

InputOutputs.Name: ClearParent
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the the movement hierarchy, leaving it free to move independently.

InputOutputs.Name: RunScriptFile
InputOutputs.Description: Load and execute a script file

InputOutputs.Name: RunScriptCode
InputOutputs.Description: Execute a fragment of script code

InputOutputs.Name: CallScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Call a script function

InputOutputs.Name: CallPrivateScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Calls a script function from this entity's private script scope.

InputOutputs.Name: CallGlobalScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Calls a script function in the global script scope.

InputOutputs.Name: Kill
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: KillHierarchy
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity and all its children from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: AddOutput
InputOutputs.Description: Adds an entity I/O connection to this entity. Parameter format: outputname>targetname>inputname>parameter>delay>max times to fire (-1 == infinite). Very dangerous, use with care.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser1 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser2 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser3 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser4 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser1 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser2 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser3 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser4 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnKilled
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the entity is killed and removed from the game.

InputOutputs.Name: OnSpawnNPC
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when an NPC is spawned. The activator is the NPC, and the string is the name of the NPC.

InputOutputs.Name: OnAllSpawned
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the spawned is exhausted (all children have been spawned).

InputOutputs.Name: OnAllSpawnedDead
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the spawner is exhausted (all children have been spawned) and all spawned children have died.

InputOutputs.Name: OnAllLiveChildrenDead
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when all spawned children have died. This does not mean the spawned is exhausted, so a new child may be spawned any time after this (unless the maker is disabled).

InputOutputs.Name: Spawn
InputOutputs.Description: Spawns an NPC.

InputOutputs.Name: Toggle
InputOutputs.Description: Toggles the spawner enabled/disabled state.

InputOutputs.Name: Enable
InputOutputs.Description: Enables the spawner.

InputOutputs.Name: Disable
InputOutputs.Description: Disables the spawner.

InputOutputs.Name: AddMaxChildren
InputOutputs.Description: Adds to the number of NPCs that can spawn before the spawner is exhausted. If an exhausted spawner is given some children to spawn, it still wont begin spawning until it is re-enabled with the Enable input.

InputOutputs.Name: SetMaxChildren
InputOutputs.Description: Sets the number of NPCs that can spawn before the spawner is exhausted. If an exhausted spawner is given some children to spawn, it still won't begin spawning until it is re-enabled with the Enable input.

InputOutputs.Name: SetMaxLiveChildren
InputOutputs.Description: Sets the maximum number of NPCs that can be alive at any one time from this spawner.

InputOutputs.Name: SetSpawnFrequency
InputOutputs.Description: Sets how often (in seconds) a new NPC will be spawned.

InputOutputs.Name: SpawnInRadius
InputOutputs.Description: Spawn an NPC somewhere within the maker's radius.

InputOutputs.Name: SpawnInLine
InputOutputs.Description: Spawn an NPC somewhere within a line behind the maker.

InputOutputs.Name: SpawnMultiple
InputOutputs.Description: Spawn multiple NPCs (uses destination group, else radius).

InputOutputs.Name: ChangeDestinationGroup
InputOutputs.Description: Switch to a different set of Destination entities.

InputOutputs.Name: SetMinimumSpawnDistance
InputOutputs.Description: Set the minimum spawn distance from player to destination node.
